rename.to: Error after migrating to v4: Property 'message' does not exist on type 'FieldErrors[]'

body:
Ok, here is an update. You need to pass an interface of your form data to useForm, but it still giving me an error on Date field. Anyway I think the best thing would be to allow the use without forcing to set the interface in useForm and let the developer decide using it or not.

```JSX
const methods = useForm<YourFormDataInterface>({ defaultValues: defaultValues, validationSchema: validationSchema });
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13320290/71531925-acc2a480-28cf-11ea-8c59-02e7da6152ee.png)

> Ok, here is an update. You need to pass an interface of your form data to useForm, but it still giving me an error on Date field. Anyway I think the best thing would be to allow the use without forcing to set the interface in useForm and let the developer decide using it or not.
> 
> ```js-jsx
> const methods = useForm<YourFormDataInterface>({ defaultValues: defaultValues, validationSchema: validationSchema });
> ```
> 
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13320290/71531925-acc2a480-28cf-11ea-8c59-02e7da6152ee.png)

This looks like a double edge sword for me. I can either pick one side...  unless someone can show me how...
May need your guys's help on this one: @stramel @barrymay (is it even possible)
I think this is possible I tried to follow the interfaces definition but not completly understanded them. Tomorrow will try again, if you have some documentation could be easier.
Hmmm i am feeling that V4 with nest errors (better TS support) at same time making your guy's life harder...
If u guys have better solution to omit the type checking (as option), please feel free to submit PR.

Hi @bluebill1049 here is a codesandbox (I don't know what's happening with type="date", it's not taking the value set in defaultValues) but hopefully it could be useful for this purpouse. There, you can check that in line 68
{errors.dateField && errors.dateField.message}
dateField.message is marked as it doesn't exists in type `FieldErrors<Date>`

[https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-typescript-dqf2j](https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-typescript-dqf2j)
thansk @cargallo i will take a look today
FYI: it should be a string type for the date input. still try to figure why there is issue using Date type tho.
